flawed_nl_solution:
When the price of the book is decreased by 3/20, the total price decrease is 3/20*$400=${<<3/20*400=60>>}60
The new price of the book becomes $400-$60 = ${<<400-60=340>>}340
The price of the book is then increased by 2/5*340 = ${<<2/5*340=316>>}316
The final price of the book is $340+$316 = ${<<340+316=656>>}656

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 136, not 316. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
